sense.def: OBI: one of the most controversial modal particles in OBI
if someone 其言之不怍， "If in making public commitments one is not shy..."
if (with non-referential subject or indefinite subject)
nominalising/subordinating a VERB with a first person subject: "in case of my V-ing", my V-ing
其來 "his coming" npro nominalises a verb phrase it precedes
someone; indefinite subject of nominalised or embedded sentence
dummy subject of a topicalised expression 其為NP也
nominaliser: 睹其子方也 "saw that he has Zifang": that npro is (an) N

entry.def: Qí 其 indicates that a statement must be true, for everything one knows, but could conceivably be false.

sense.def: presumably, - I suppose , one would surely have thought

entry.def: Qí 其 "or should one" is idiomatic in deliberating questions.

sense.def: or shall we, or should we?; or perhaps; either... or;Note OBI: 其 V 其弗 V: whether we V or not ZGC: 其不乎？ "or not?"

entry.def: Qí 其 is a modal particle indicating weakly and abstractly that something should probably be done or happen. The word is thus marginal in this group. See SHOULD [padV]

sense.def: 其人"the right person": the right N; the right kind of N, the appropriate, the relevant, the suitable
PRESENT: must be deemed to, be so V!, 多麼; FUTURE: will certainly!; will presumably; will according to reasonable expectations
it must certainly be N that V-s
When a(ny) given (hypothetical) N V-s, then S

entry.def: Qí 其 "when" really only serves to mark a general subordinating particle which occasionally comes to be translatable by "when".

sense.def: forms a "nominalised" subordinate clause "his doing so and so"
particle without grammatical function, poetic filler in a part of a line that is regularly filled with a variety of grammatical particles in adjacent lines

entry.def: Qí 其 expresses a colourless rather weak obligation to do something.

sense.def: one of (the CLASS MEMBER of the class designated by preceding NP) 其南陵， That ridge on the south (of the ridges mentioned in general above)
N lives in the place npro 移其民"move the people of the place"
Nab is an ABSTRACT FEATURE of npro. 修其孝悌忠信"cultivate their filial and fraternal love, the loyality and trustworthiness"
N is an inalienable part of npro 其心 "his heart/mind/attitude"
必危其身 "one is bound to endanger one's person" "one's N"
失其親 "fail one's parents" N has the KINSHIP RELATION to npro
N has the SOCIAL RELATION N to npro
non-referential: one's own 其身正 "If one's own person is correct..."
the N to be specified below
=其所 the N the subjects Vt-s 其得言 "the words/opinions one gets to hear"
其善者少 "Those who are good are few": SUBCLASS OF npro the N among the npros
the N that is destined for npro, the N that is meant for npro
讀其書不知其人可乎？“reading (out) someone's writings and not knowing anything about him (i.e. the writer), is that acceptable?" the N authored by npro
e.g. 其言 'his speech': npro is the subject or origin of N
used as equivalent to 之 if the modifier is a demonstrative pronoun (是其 + N, 此其 + N)
as in 刻其桷：carved its rafters
其書五車 "his books filled five carts":his, her their writings
其馬 "his horse": his her their: npro owns/possesses N
必聞其政 "be sure to hear about it's government": npro is the object of the transitive action Nab

gramGrp.tls:sem-feat: Nab is INALIENABLE FEATURE of npro

sense.def: 觀其志 "observe his intentions": Nab is an inalienable feature of npro
其從者 "his followers": the Vt-ers of the object npro
其來者 “those who COME FROM THERE":
惡其賊 "hates his malefactors": npro is the object of the transitivity in Ntr
pronoun modifying a nominalised verbal expression

gramGrp.tls:sem-feat: WHETHER npro IS V OR NOT

sense.def: 其故 "the cause/reason for it": npro SPECIFIES WHAT IS EXPLAINED by Nab

gramGrp.tls:sem-feat: FACTIVE: his/her/their V>Nab, or that npro is V-ing

sense.def: 其他 "other things than this": npro defines the sope of the relation in npro2: e.g. "other (things) in relations to/than npro1"
其誰“who of them": npro1 restricts the reference of npro2
"the relevant N, that relevant N, the N in question, the N involved"
"a certain (NP)", the「不在其位，不謀其政。 "When one does not hold a certian position one does not make plans for the administration of that position."
this; marking embedded sentential objects: that this
non-anaphoric but context-determined: amounts of the relevant
pivotal pronoun, as in 不能令其下也
(in subordinate sentences) he, she, it, they
singular: the subject's, her, his, its
